title: Design System Foundation Complete
details:
## Design System Foundation - COMPLETE ✅

**Task ID:** a3d87d2d-1855-493d-bf3c-ad2d26d2bd2e
**Completion Date:** 2025-07-27
**Time Taken:** 2 hours (vs 8 hour estimate)

### Major Accomplishments:

**1. Comprehensive CSS Design Token System**
- WCAG 2.2 AA compliant color palette with 4.5:1+ contrast ratios
- ADHD-specific energy level colors (Red/Yellow/Green) for task prioritization
- Typography system with 1.5x line heights for better readability
- 8px-based spacing grid for consistency
- Semantic token layer for light/dark themes
- Accessibility media queries (prefers-reduced-motion, prefers-contrast)

**2. TypeScript Design Token Library**
- Type-safe design token definitions with IntelliSense support
- Component variant specifications for buttons, inputs, etc.
- Energy level management utilities for ADHD task organization
- Accessibility helper functions and constants
- Theme configuration interfaces with proper typing

**3. Tailwind CSS Integration**
- Successfully migrated from DaisyUI to custom design system
- Extended Tailwind with CSS variable-based tokens for runtime theming
- Custom utility classes for ADHD-friendly spacing patterns
- Motion-safe and accessibility utilities built-in
- Focus ring utilities for keyboard navigation

**4. Next.js Theme Provider System**
- Integrated next-themes for seamless light/dark/system theme switching
- Built accessible theme toggle component with keyboard navigation
- Prevented hydration mismatches with proper SSR handling
- Theme persistence across sessions

**5. Updated Application Architecture**
- Replaced DaisyUI completely with custom ADHD-friendly design
- Updated homepage to demonstrate design system capabilities
- Integrated theme provider into app provider structure
- Added comprehensive navigation with theme toggle

### Key Technical Decisions:

**Accessibility First:**
- WCAG 2.2 AA compliance throughout
- Screen reader optimizations with sr-only utilities
- Keyboard navigation support
- Motion preference respect (prefers-reduced-motion)
- High contrast mode support

**ADHD-Specific Features:**
- Energy level color coding for task management
- Generous spacing to reduce cognitive load
- Predictable navigation patterns
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Distraction minimization

**Developer Experience:**
- Type-safe design tokens prevent inconsistencies
- CSS variables enable runtime theme switching
- Modular token architecture for easy maintenance
- Comprehensive documentation in code

### Files Created/Modified:
- `frontend/src/app/globals.css` - Complete design token system
- `frontend/src/lib/design-tokens.ts` - TypeScript definitions
- `frontend/tailwind.config.js` - Custom token integration
- `frontend/src/components/ui/theme-provider.tsx` - Theme management
- `frontend/src/components/ui/theme-toggle.tsx` - Accessible theme switcher
- `frontend/src/app/providers.tsx` - Updated provider structure
- `frontend/src/app/layout.tsx` - Updated layout structure
- `frontend/src/app/page.tsx` - Design system demonstration

### Verification Results:
- ✅ Development server runs without errors (localhost:3000)
- ✅ Theme switching works seamlessly
- ✅ All CSS variables properly defined and accessible
- ✅ TypeScript compilation successful
- ✅ Accessibility features functional
- ✅ ADHD-specific patterns demonstrated

### Next Steps:
Ready to proceed with component library development using this foundation. The design system provides a solid base for building accessible, ADHD-friendly UI components.
